Description: Conical foot sherd (mended from five fragments) of Chian pottery chalice; white slip; exterior glazed streaky black; reserve edge of foot and underside; inscriptions on interior and exterior.
Curator's comments: the incline of the foot suggests that it is later than the Wild Goat Style and could fit in the Mature Animal Style, Grand Style and Chalice Style.
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 64, no. 752, pl. XXI, no. 752)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 681, no. 403)
Johnston 2006a / Trademarks on Greek Vases: Addenda (p. 170, no. 52)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0688) (phase 2)
